titleStmt.title: Dæneids, or The noble labours of the great dean of Notre-Dame in Paris for the erecting in his quire a throne for his glory, and the eclipsing the pride of an imperious, usurping character, an heroique poem in four canto's, containing a true history, and shews the folly, foppery, luxury, laziness, pride, ambition, and contention of the Romanish clergy.
titleStmt.author: Crown, Mr. (John), 1640?-1712.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in British Museum Library.
Attributed to John Crowne. cf. BM.
